definition: (prefix indicating ordinal number, e.g. first, number two etc)/order/(old) rank in the imperial examinations/mansion/(literary) but/just
season/the last month of a season/fourth or youngest amongst brothers/classifier for seasonal crop yields
to pass/to spend (time)/measure/limit/extent/degree of intensity/degree (angles, temperature etc)/kilowatt-hour/classifier for events and occurrences

sentences.english: It also comes after the company last month gave a weaker-than-expected outlook for the fiscal fourth quarter.
sentences.chinese: 博科公司上個月公佈的第四季度企業前景不如預期。

sentences.english: This decline was most pronounced in the fourth quarter of 2008.
sentences.chinese: 這種衰退的趨勢在2008年第四季度最爲明顯。

sentences.english: The company hopes to begin ethanol sales in the fourth quarter.
sentences.chinese: 公司希望能夠在第四季度內開始乙醇的銷售。

sentences.english: Prices for fourth quarter cruises are down year-over-year, too.
sentences.chinese: 第四季度郵輪價格也將低於去年同期。

sentences.english: 'For the fourth quarter, it appears likely that the economy is contracting significantly, ' Ms. Yellen said.
sentences.chinese: 耶倫說，第四季度經濟看起來很可能正在嚴重萎縮。

sentences.english: We like our Chinese employees, " Schmidt said last week on Google's fourth-quarter earnings call."
sentences.chinese: 斯米特在上週公司的第四季度財務遠程會議上說。

sentences.english: Reserve growth stopped in the fourth quarter.
sentences.chinese: 在第四季度外匯儲備停止增長。

sentences.english: Also, fourth-quarter consumer spending appears to be perking up.
sentences.chinese: 此外，第四季度消費者消費額趨於上揚。
